intro: Acinodendron caudatum, commonly known as the long-tailed acacia, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its compound leaves and pod fruits. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its flowers are small and yellow, arranged in racemes, and it produces elongated, woody pods that contain seeds. Acinodendron caudatum is adapted to tropical and subtropical climates, often found in moist, well-drained soils.
